page.title: 08BICKLEIGH CHURCH
page.content: The parish church of St. Mary the Virgin is in the quiet centre of the village. Parish registers begin in the year 1573, earlier ones having been lost. The present church dates from 1268, the main shell of tower, chancel and nave being enlarged by a south aisle in C15th. A Norman tub font, capitals to the C15th arches, carved bench ends and tombs of the local Carew family are the most attractive details of the interior. The church was completely restored in 1848, and bells, added to over the years, were completed by a sixth in 1908. Bickleigh is one of the Exe Valley Group of 14 parishes. Regular Sunday services are held, and the main festivals of the Christian year are well attended.
